Home.title: Frontend Developer React and Next.js
Home.text:
Frontend web developer, I use React, Next.js, and TypeScript to design modern and responsive interfaces.

I also have knowledge in back-end development with PostgreSQL, Node.js, and Prisma, allowing me to understand the entire web development process.

CarouselHome.simonGame: Creation of a Simon game using React. Project to understand state management, component life cycles, and hooks.
CarouselHome.argentBank: Integration of a banking application, with authentication system via an API and a global store via Redux.
CarouselHome.ninaCarducci: Optimization of a photographer's website on natural referencing, performance, and accessibility.
CarouselHome.kasa: Integration of a real estate rental site. Project to manage routes, URL parameters, and implement CSS animations via Sass.
CarouselHome.qcm: Creation of a quiz application. Project to manage a database with an ORM, create an authentication system with a JWT token, and secure routes.

gus.title: GitHub User Search
gus.description:
GitHub user search application. Project from the Frontend Mentor site.

Pixel-perfect integration of a mockup in responsive design, with a user search system via the GitHub API to find and display user account information.

The application also has a light and dark theme system set by default according to user preference.

blog.title: Blog and Devtools
blog.description:
Personal blog and development tools project.

The content of the blog section is created using the headless CMS Sanity.io, the development tools section is created in React.

The site has a search bar coded from scratch to find articles or tools. The article search is done via GROQ queries and the Sanity.io API, the tool search is done via a JSON list.

finance.title: Personnal Finance App
finance.description:
Work in Progress

Personal finance tracking application. Project from the Frontend Mentor site.

Project under development, the application will allow you to track your expenses and income, categorize them, and visualize them in the form of graphs. The data is currently stored in a JSON file, but will soon be stored in a database or a headless CMS.
